conclusion: Analyze forces and determine change in electric potential energy.
Two forces act on the ball: gravitational force downward and electric force horizontally opposite to the field.
For linear motion, resultant force must be along the direction of motion, balancing perpendicular components.
Gravitational force has no horizontal component; electric force is horizontal.
Vertical component of velocity is due to gravity for straight-line motion.
At highest point, vertical velocity component is zero; calculate time to reach it.
Time to reach highest point is t = (v_0 sin θ) / g.
Horizontal displacement during this time is d = (v_0^2 sin θ cos θ) / g.
Change in electric potential energy ΔU = qE * d.
ΔU = (qE v_0^2 sin θ cos θ) / g.
Difference in electric potential energy at highest point is (qE v_0^2 sin θ cos θ) / g.
